result.execSummary:
Santiago Balboa Cruz was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Santiago Balboa Cruz was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santiago Balboa Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:17pm [mo]
Defendant Santiago Balboa Cruz appears in court, in custody.   Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish interpreter.

Right to Counsel given to Mr. Cruz.
Mr. Cruz indicates that he would like representation.
recess:1:20--1:27pm reconvene: [to allow Clerk to check availability of attorney from PD office]

Attorney Svehlek arrives in the courtroom at 1:27pm
The Court orders for the courtroom to be cleared, with the exception of the Deputy and the Clerk, to allow discussion of Mr. Balboa Cruz and Attorney Svehlek. 
recess: 1:30pm--reconvene: 1:43pm

Attorney Svehlek indicates that she will not be opening a file on Mr Cruz, nor did she conduct a financial interview.
Attorney Svehlek will represent Mr. Cruz for purposes of this hearing. 
The Court confirms the name and date of birth of defendant.
The Court confirms that Mr. Cruz is the person named in said warrant.
--Attorney Svehlek agrees
The Court finds that the individual in court is the same person that is named in the extradiction forecast and the warrant. 
The Court informs Mr. Cruz that he has the right to have Govenor of Illinois serve warrant, and hapeus corpus relief.
Mr. Cruz waives his right to extradiction and hapeus corpus
The Court observes the signing of 3 originals of the Waiver of Extradiction.
The Court signs the 3 originals of the Waiver of Extradiction. 
The Court notes that if the State of Illinois have not acted on Mr. Cruz within 5 days, the case shall be recalled before Branch III.
The jail is directed to advise the Court and the State if Mr. Cruz has not been taken into custody by the State of Illinois within 5 days, or some other type of transport by Jefferson Co. Sheriff to State of Illinois. 
recess:1:58pm


NEXT: If State of Illinois has not acted on Mr. Cruz within 5 days hearing should be scheduled before Branch III.
